reviews.text: A tidy complex, very friendly staff who were a pleasure to deal with. Would have given 5 days had the room not had a strong cleaning chemical smell. Worst i've come accross. A few other rooms seemed to be the same.
reviews.title: Clean and friendly staff

reviews.text: We have stayed for 4 nights. Staff is very friendly, location is good. Walk of fame is in a walking distance and Universal City is 20min.away by metro which is very close to the hotel. We have seen most of the places by using public transportation and managed to go either by metro, bus or both. Plus the room was very very clean. We experineced only two drawbacks: First one is lack of beacon lamp in the room. There are two floor lamps in the room which were not enough to illuminate. Secondly, although i have requested to stay away from the jakuzzi and in the second floor, we have stayed right in front of the jakuzzi in the first floor and it was too noisy especially at nights. The engines of the mechanism to heat the jakuzzi makes too much of noise right in front of your room and adding the laughters, chats and making fun of people among each other does not help when trying to sleep or rest.
reviews.title: worth the money

reviews.text: We stayed here two nights for a family vacation prior to a cruise. We were a little concerned with the few comments that questioned the safety of location, but were very pleased with our stay. Yes to dated comments and could it could use some facelift work, but the rooms were very clean and the beds comfortable. All the staff were very good. We had four rooms in total and each person was pleased with the hotel and would definatley stay there again. Also a nice pool area was a bonus. Two went to a Dodgers game and found that very easy to get to via a special bus that goes right to the stadium. The location was easy to visit tourist spots such as universal, stars walk of fame, etc. Starbucks and Ralphs grocery store were just a few steps away and the subway was the next street over. We called for a car service to get to us to the port and they sent two vans for us. The driver gave us such a great tour on our way to the port that we called her when we completed the cruise to take us to our hotel and then another tour! That wasd A-1Express Shuttle. We booked Elaine
reviews.title: Good value, convenient location, very good staff

reviews.text: If you don't want to break the bank and aren't high maintenance this is the perfect motel for you. I was pleasantly surprised upon check in. The motel has a very quaint courtyard with lots of flowers and a built in pool. My room was on the second floor. My only complaint (its not really a complaint) is the motel is older and my room had an odor but once you are in it for about 5 minutes it goes away. Bed linens were clean and the bathroom was spotless and that's really my only MUSTS. As a bonus, the bed was super comfortable. All in all, a great price for L.A. and near LOTS of tourist spots.
reviews.title: Quaint Older Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night en route to Vegas. The reception area was dark and seedy really not very appealing. We got to our room which was outdated and in dire need of repair and renovation. I did not feel safe here, there was a lot of shouting and could hear an argument in another room. The one pillow we had each was lumpy and very uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Scary Place!

reviews.text: We loved this motel and it could not have been better located! We didn't have a car and so used the underground quite a lot. The Hollywood and Western station was only a 2 minute walk away so we could access lots of areas very quickly.  Only 2 stops way from the walk of fame and all the touristy stuff that goes with it. About 3 stops to Universal Studios.
reviews.title: Excellent choice!!!

reviews.text: There is also a supermarket right next door so you can fill your room fridge up with water / milk / fruit. You can also borrow plates / bowls and cutlery from the hotel so you could easily eat breakfast in your room every morning. We usually just went to Starbucks which was next door to pick up a coffee / fruit cup etc to start the day.
reviews.title: Lovely little hotel,

reviews.text: The room itself was spotless as was the bathroom - top marks for cleanliness!  Free wireless internet was fast and always online.  The bed was really comfortable and the pool / spa area was clean and quiet.   The laundry room was excellent and only $2 to wash and $2 to dry, you could also use the computer and a microwave in that room.
reviews.title: Great find in a great location

reviews.text: There are a couple if really good places to eat nearby! The Dixie Hollywood which was just round the corner on Hollywood Blvd do a great brunch and on our last night we found a great Thai place just across the road from the Dixie which was super cheap (around $7 a meal) and very tasty!
reviews.title: A hidden gem

reviews.text: This is an excellent choice for those who don't want to break the bank, have comfort and cleanliness high on their agenda and want to be in a great location.  I certainly wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!
reviews.title: Overall a good place to stay

reviews.text: We were a family of 3 adults and 3 year old child. On arrival a bit scary, but that's because it's safe & secure. The inner courtyard is a delightful oasis, with heated jacuzzi & pool, lots of flowers and vines, and lovely sitting areas. Tea lights for evening sitting. Very peaceful and quiet. Small rooms and bathrooms, but good beds, pillows, fridge, coffee machine etc. bathroom spotless and lots of hot water. Stayed 3 nights and slept very well every night. Has separate room with washer & dryer, free computer/ wifi, and microwave so we made our own breakfast every morning. On arrival we found our TV wouldn't change channels and it was replaced within 5 minutes. I accidently left my iPad in the garden in the morning and was returned to me in the afternoon when I returned. I hadn't even missed it. So, I only have good things to say about this motel, with very nice hosts who are aware that little extras and a nice ambience make a big difference in the noisy bustle that is Hollywood.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Motel is definitely old and is a little scary looking upon first sight, and if you're bothered by small things such as screens on the windows not fitting properly, smallish rooms and baths, then this is not the place for you. However everything was clean, the pool, the rooms were made up properly etc. The staff was polite and friendly. It doesn't have breakfast but there is a large grocery chain around the corner and numerous lunch and dinner places within a block or two. The room has a mini-fridge, hair dryer, and wi-fi and there is a common room with a computer, microwave, ice machine, and laundry facilities. We stayed there 6 nights and would stay again.
reviews.title: Adequate Inexpensive Hotel in Hollywood

reviews.text: After 36 hours on a plane or in an airport, this hotel will seem the better one in all Los Angeles. It's old, it needs to be restore, it has no breakfast service, but it's perfectly located to visit Hollywood and it's quite cheap.
reviews.title: Zzzzzzzzzz

reviews.text: Stayed 7 nights.
reviews.title: Good price and facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only a few steps away from Metro red line station.
reviews.title: Charming!

reviews.text: After driving to LA and not having a hotel booked, I ended up coming to this place and would recommend it to anyone who's trying to save money. The location is great, the staff was great, the rooms are clean. It was a quiet little place that seemed to be fairly busy with other young couples. I can't say I felt as safe as if I was at a nicer hotel, but you get what you pay for. It will be a good story to tell.
reviews.title: Great Value and Location

reviews.text: I stayed in this motel as a single female traveller. The staff were amazing and always made me feel safe. They carried my bag up to the room and refused to let me tip them. They were always willing to answer any questions or help out in any way.
reviews.title: Cute Motel

reviews.text: The area was a bit iffy, with lots of sketchy people wandering around the motel, especially after dark. However, it is a great walking distance to catch the metro and close to a Starbucks.
reviews.title: Not on your life!
great stay for budget conscious traveller
reviews.text: The rooms were average. I had a king bed which was comfy and clean. The bathrooms are really small, but clean. The pool, hot tub and garden are a great place to hang out, but can get noisy at night. Overall, my stay was very enjoyable. Thank you coral motel.

Dumpy rooms, small blurry tv! $10+ Tax per visitor give me a break!!! Beds squeak so bad you feel it's gonna break! Exterior of inside of hotel property very clean and nice but overall for $80+ per night before taxes and fees, I'd choose motel 6!!! TV is small and poor and wifi signal week it felt like a hooker motel but sucks!!
reviews.title: shabby and dishonest
